Description: Bell: egg-shaped bell with oval rim now much damaged at the back. The front of the bell is worked to represent the face of the god Bes, and at the top a small capital supports the god's plumes, behind which a semicircular ring forms the handle. The tongue of the bell is missing. The instrument has been cast in one piece.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: 'A Guide to the Fourth, Fifth and Sixth Egyptian Rooms, and the Coptic Room' (1922), p. 212 E.A. Wallis Budge, 'The Mummy' (1925), p. 368 Published: Anderson, 1976, Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities III, Musical Instruments, (1976), p.32 (33), fig.48. Budge, Mummy, p.368.
